intro: Eugenia holmanii, commonly known as the Holman’s guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. The fruit is edible, though it is less commonly cultivated compared to other guava species.
